texts.definition: The act of getting access to additional abilities or game-related content.
markups: <style="Definition">The act of getting access to additional abilities or game-related content.</style>

Many games withhold abilities or content from players until they have met certain requirements, which may be as simple as reaching a certain level of completing the game or proving a certain level of game mastery. When players have been aware of these abilities or content before they are revealed the act of <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> them becomes significant in itself.

Note: ''This pattern does not look at the opening up of new spatial areas in <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style>, see <style="Link"><link="access-rewards">Access Rewards</link></style> for discussions on that (and the type of access to game content discussed here(.

Players of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Tabletop%20Roleplaying%20Games">Tabletop Roleplaying Games</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dungeons%20&%20Dragons">Dungeons & Dragons</link></style> could unlock new powers and skills by gaining character levels. This is also found in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Computer-based%20Roleplaying%20Games">Computer-based Roleplaying Games</link></style> but may here take the form of development trees, as for example in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dragon%20Age%20series">Dragon Age series</link></style>. Similar trees exist in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:FPS%20Games">First-Person Shooters</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Borderlands">Borderlands</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dead%20Island">Dead Island</link></style>. <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> new weapons in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Battlefield%20series">Battlefield series</link></style> does not give access to better weapons but rather ones that are more specialized.

Games on social network platforms such as Facebook, e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/CityVille">CityVille</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Empires%20&%20Allies">Empires & Allies</link></style>, also make use of <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> but here this is typically tied to being able to finish constructions and players can pay money to do this instead of having to get the help from a certain amount of friends.

Designing for players to be able to perform <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> in games rely on deciding what <style="Link"><link="abilities">Abilities</link></style> or game-related content can be unlocked and announcing this to the players. <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> is often applied to control how <style="Link"><link="privileged-abilities">Privileged Abilities</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="vehicles">Vehicles</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="weapons">Weapons</link></style> are introduced into gameplay. <style="Link"><link="sidegrades">Sidegrades</link></style> is a specific type of game content acquired by <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> that instead of directly improving players' abilities give them a greater <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style>.

<style="Link"><link="achievements">Achievements</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Development%20Trees">Development Trees</link></style>, the latter linked for example to <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Powers">Powers</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="skills">Skills</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Technologies">Technologies</link></style>, are examples of patterns that by their nature provide <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> so implementing these in a game also create the <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> pattern. <style="Link"><link="abstract-player-construct-development">Abstract Player Construct Development</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="character-development">Character Development</link></style> can also provide <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> through the use of <style="Link"><link="character-levels">Character Levels</link></style>, the already mentioned <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Development%20Trees">Development Trees</link></style>, or more specialized solutions. For games with explicit <style="Link"><link="endgame">Endgame</link></style> phases, e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/World%20of%20Warcraft">World of Warcraft</link></style>, reaching theses can result in the <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> of new gameplay content. <style="Link"><link="endgame-quests">Endgame Quests</link></style> are specifically packaged gameplay content used for this purpose.

Having sufficient numbers of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Neighbors">Neighbors</link></style>, or getting help from them, is a way of implementing <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/CityVille">CityVille</link></style> and other games on social network platforms; for these games <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> is typically also <style="Link"><link="purchasable-game-advantages">Purchasable Game Advantages</link></style>.

Since <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> is the act of gaining access to something preordained, this can easily be felt as a <style="Link"><link="rewards">Reward</link></style>, or more precisely an <style="Link"><link="access-rewards">Access Reward</link></style> than gives <style="Link"><link="value-effort">Value of Effort</link></style> to the actions leading up to the <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style>; an exception to this if the <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> is a result of an <style="Link"><link="purchasable-game-advantages">Purchasable Game Advantages</link></style>. Knowing about the possibility of <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> something makes it possible to have <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Anticipation">Anticipation</link></style> about this and can motivate both <style="Link"><link="grinding">Grinding</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="player-planned-development">Player-Planned Development</link></style>. It however ruins the possibilities that the effects of the <style="CurrentLink">Unlocking</style> actions are <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Surprises">Surprises</link></style>.
